bibl.title: Cultic Persona and the Transmission of the Partheneions.

series.title: Aarhus Studies in Mediterranean Antiquity. ASMA.

bibl.note: Paper based on an international conference organized at the Centre for the Study of Antiquity and the Department of Classical Archaeology, University of Aarhus, Denmark, 9-10 January . - Claims that all names in the most famous of Alkman's partheneions (Hagesichora, Agido, etc.) are role-names.

bibl.title: Aspects of Ancient Greek Cult. Context, Ritual and Iconography

bibl.seg: HINGE George, Cultic Persona and the Transmission of the Partheneions.

Jesper Tae JENSEN, George HINGE, Peter SCHULTZ and Bronwen WICKKISER (Edd.), Aspects of Ancient Greek Cult. Context, Ritual and Iconography = Aarhus Studies in Mediterranean Antiquity. ASMA. 8 (Aarhus, 2009) pp. 215-236.

Paper based on an international conference organized at the Centre for the Study of Antiquity and the Department of Classical Archaeology, University of Aarhus, Denmark, 9-10 January . - Claims that all names in the most famous of Alkman's partheneions (Hagesichora, Agido, etc.) are role-names.
